data.title: Catalan Romanesque Churches of the Vall de Boí
data.text: The Churches of the Vall de Bo are a set of nine Early Romanesque churches declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO and located in the Vall de Bo, in the Catalan comarca of Alta Ribagora (Province of Lleida).World Heritage Site.UNESCO declared World Heritage Sites in 2000 to nine churches:History of the frescoes of the Vall de Bo.During the early 20th century there was a major effort to study and catalog the Romanesque wall paintings in the churches of the Vall de Bo area. This activity was driven by both the academic interests of scholars, and by art dealers (whose motives were financial gain).
